014package org.jdbi.v3.core.statement;
015
016import java.util.Optional;
017import java.util.function.Function;
018
019import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.ConfigRegistry;
020import org.jdbi.v3.meta.Beta;
021
022/**
023 * Renders an SQL statement from a template.
024 *
025 * Note for implementors: define a suitable public constructor for SqlObject's {@code UseTemplateEngine} annotation, and/or create your own custom annotation in case your {@link TemplateEngine} has configuration parameters! Suitable constructors are the no-arg constructor, one that takes a {@link java.lang.Class}, and one that takes both a {@link java.lang.Class} and a {@link java.lang.reflect.Method}.
026 *
027 * @see DefinedAttributeTemplateEngine
028 */
029@FunctionalInterface
030@SuppressWarnings("FunctionalInterfaceMethodChanged") // this is a false positive b/c a lambda can only be casted to TemplateEngine or Parsing, not both
031public interface TemplateEngine {
032    /**
033     * Convenience constant that returns the input template.
034     */
035    TemplateEngine NOP = new NoTemplateEngine();
036
037    /**
038     * Renders an SQL statement from the given template, using the statement
039     * context as needed.
040     *
041     * @param template The SQL to rewrite
042     * @param ctx      The statement context for the statement being executed
043     * @return something which can provide the actual SQL to prepare a statement from
044     * and which can bind the correct arguments to that prepared statement
045     */
046    String render(String template, StatementContext ctx);
047
048    /**
049     * Parse a SQL template and return a parsed representation ready to apply to a statement.
050     * This allows the parsed representation to be cached and reused.
051     * @param template the sql template to parse
052     * @param config the Jdbi configuration at prepare time
053     * @return a parsed representation, if available
054     */
055    @Beta
056    default Optional<Function<StatementContext, String>> parse(String template, ConfigRegistry config) {
057        return Optional.empty();
058    }
059
060    @FunctionalInterface
061    @Beta
062    interface Parsing extends TemplateEngine {
063        @Override
064        default String render(String template, StatementContext ctx) {
065            return parse(template, ctx.getConfig())
066                    .orElseThrow(() -> new UnableToCreateStatementException("Caching template engine did not prepare"))
067                    .apply(ctx);
068        }
069
070        @Override
071        Optional<Function<StatementContext, String>> parse(String template, ConfigRegistry config);
072    }
073}
